entry.title: Birth of BASIC
entry.quote: Professors John Kemeny and Tom Kurtz along with a band of Dartmouth undergraduates invent the Basic computer language.

entry.title: Levi Walter Yaggy’s Geographical Maps and Charts (1887/93)
entry.quote: Levi Walter Yaggy’s Geographical Study unpacks like a matryoshka doll.

entry.title: Why all of Hollywood UI looks the same
entry.quote: When we are shown a glimpse of the far future through science fiction films, there are omnipresent voice assistants, otherworldly wearables, and a whole lot of holograms. For whatever reason these holograms are almost always blue, floating above desks and visible to anyone who might stroll by.

entry.title: In-Car Climate Control Design: How It Has Gone Backwards and How to Fix It
entry.quote: Climate controls are a fascinating design problem. They may seem easy to design on the surface, but you quickly run into much complexity. In the last couple of years, the design of in-car climate controls has gone backward. In this post, I will show why this happened and propose a different way to design climate controls.

entry.title: Whispers of A.I.’s Modular Future
entry.quote: ChatGPT is in the spotlight, but it’s Whisper—OpenAI’s open-source speech-transcription program—that shows us where machine learning is going.

entry.title: Apple Makes Major Progress on No-Prick Blood Glucose Tracking for Its Watch
entry.quote: Apple Inc. has a moonshot-style project underway that dates back to the Steve Jobs era: noninvasive and continuous blood glucose monitorin
